00080 bool core_t::static_members_initialized = false;
00081 struct core_t::uop_array_t * core_t::uop_array_pool[MD_MAX_FLOWLEN+2+1];
00082 struct odep_t * core_t::odep_free_pool = NULL;
00083 int core_t::odep_free_pool_debt = 0;
00084 seq_t core_t::global_seq = 0;

00087 /* CONSTRUCTOR */
00088 core_t::core_t(const int core_id):
00089   knobs(NULL), current_thread(NULL), id(core_id),
00090   num_emergency_recoveries(0), last_emergency_recovery_count(0),
00091   oracle(NULL), fetch(NULL), decode(NULL), alloc(NULL),
00092   exec(NULL), commit(NULL), global_action_id(0)
00093 {
00094   memzero(&memory,sizeof(memory));
00095   memzero(&stat,sizeof(stat));
00096 
00097   assert(sizeof(struct uop_array_t) % 16 == 0);
00098 
00099   if(!static_members_initialized)
00100   {
00101     memzero(uop_array_pool,sizeof(uop_array_pool));
00102     static_members_initialized = true;
00103   }
00104 }
00105 
00106 /* assign a new, unique id */
00107 seq_t core_t::new_action_id(void)
00108 {
00109   global_action_id++;
00110   return global_action_id;
00111 }
00112 
00113 /* Returns an array of uop structs; manages its own free pool by
00114    size.  The input to this function should be the Mop's uop flow
00115    length.  The implementation of this is slightly (very?) ugly; see
00116    the definition of struct uop_array_t.  We basically define a
00117    struct that contains a pointer for linking everything up in the
00118    free lists, but we don't actually want the outside world to know
00119    about these pointers, so we actually return a pointer that is !=
00120    to the original address returned by calloc.  If you're familiar
00121    with the original cache structures from the old SimpleScalar, we
00122    declare our uop_array_t similar to that. */
00123 struct uop_t * core_t::get_uop_array(const int size)
00124 {
00125   struct uop_array_t * p;
00126 
00127   if(uop_array_pool[size])
00128   {
00129     p = uop_array_pool[size];
00130     uop_array_pool[size] = p->next;
00131     p->next = NULL;
00132     assert(p->size == size);
00133   }
00134   else
00135   {
00136     //p = (struct uop_array_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(*p)+size*sizeof(struct uop_t));
00137     posix_memalign((void**)&p,16,sizeof(*p)+size*sizeof(struct uop_t)); // force all uops to be 16-byte aligned
00138     if(!p)
00139       fatal("couldn't calloc new uop array");
00140     p->size = size;
00141     p->next = NULL;
00142   }
00143   /* initialize the uop array */
00144   for(int i=0;i<size;i++)
00145     uop_init(&p->uop[i]);
00146   return p->uop;
00147 }
00148 
00149 void core_t::return_uop_array(struct uop_t * const p)
00150 {
00151   struct uop_array_t * ap;
00152   byte_t * bp = (byte_t*)p;
00153   bp -= offsetof(struct uop_array_t,uop);
00154   ap = (struct uop_array_t *) bp;
00155 
00156   assert(ap->next == NULL);
00157   ap->next = uop_array_pool[ap->size];
00158   uop_array_pool[ap->size] = ap;
00159 }
00160 
00161 /* Alloc/dealloc of the linked-list container nodes */
00162 struct odep_t * core_t::get_odep_link(void)
00163 {
00164   struct odep_t * p = NULL;
00165   if(odep_free_pool)
00166   {
00167     p = odep_free_pool;
00168     odep_free_pool = p->next;
00169   }
00170   else
00171   {
00172     p = (struct odep_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(*p));
00173     if(!p)
00174       fatal("couldn't calloc an odep_t node");
00175   }
00176   assert(p);
00177   p->next = NULL;
00178   odep_free_pool_debt++;
00179   return p;
00180 }
00181 
00182 void core_t::return_odep_link(struct odep_t * const p)
00183 {
00184   p->next = odep_free_pool;
00185   odep_free_pool = p;
00186   p->uop = NULL;
00187   odep_free_pool_debt--;
00188   /* p->next used for free list, will be cleared on "get" */
00189 }
00190 
00191 /* all sizes/loop lengths known at compile time; compiler
00192    should be able to optimize this pretty well.  Assumes
00193    uop is aligned to 16 bytes. */
00194 void core_t::zero_uop(struct uop_t * const uop)
00195 {
00196 #if USE_SSE_MOVE
00197   char * addr = (char*) uop;
00198   int bytes = sizeof(*uop);
00199   int remainder = bytes - (bytes>>7)*128;
00200 
00201   /* zero xmm0 */
00202   asm ("xorps %%xmm0, %%xmm0"
00203        : : : "%xmm0");
00204   /* clear the uop 64 bytes at a time */
00205   for(int i=0;i<bytes>>7;i++)
00206   {
00207     asm ("movaps %%xmm0,    (%0)\n\t"
00208          "movaps %%xmm0,  16(%0)\n\t"
00209          "movaps %%xmm0,  32(%0)\n\t"
00210          "movaps %%xmm0,  48(%0)\n\t"
00211          "movaps %%xmm0,  64(%0)\n\t"
00212          "movaps %%xmm0,  80(%0)\n\t"
00213          "movaps %%xmm0,  96(%0)\n\t"
00214          "movaps %%xmm0, 112(%0)\n\t"
00215          : : "r"(addr) : "memory");
00216     addr += 128;
00217   }
00218 
00219   /* handle any remaining bytes; optimizer should remove this
00220      when sizeof(uop) has no remainder */
00221   for(int i=0;i<remainder>>3;i++)
00222   {
00223     asm ("movlps %%xmm0,   (%0)\n\t"
00224          : : "r"(addr) : "memory");
00225     addr += 8;
00226   }
00227 #else
00228   memset(uop,0,sizeof(*uop));
00229 #endif
00230 }
00231 
00232 void core_t::zero_Mop(struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00233 {
00234 #if USE_SSE_MOVE
00235   char * addr = (char*) Mop;
00236   int bytes = sizeof(*Mop);
00237   int remainder = bytes - (bytes>>6)*64;
00238 
00239   /* zero xmm0 */
00240   asm ("xorps %%xmm0, %%xmm0"
00241        : : : "%xmm0");
00242   /* clear the uop 64 bytes at a time */
00243   for(int i=0;i<bytes>>6;i++)
00244   {
00245     asm ("movaps %%xmm0,   (%0)\n\t"
00246          "movaps %%xmm0, 16(%0)\n\t"
00247          "movaps %%xmm0, 32(%0)\n\t"
00248          "movaps %%xmm0, 48(%0)\n\t"
00249          : : "r"(addr) : "memory");
00250     addr += 64;
00251   }
00252 
00253   /* handle any remaining bytes */
00254   for(int i=0;i<remainder>>3;i++)
00255   {
00256     asm ("movlps %%xmm0,   (%0)\n\t"
00257          : : "r"(addr) : "memory");
00258     addr += 8;
00259   }
00260 #else
00261   memset(Mop,0,sizeof(*Mop));
00262 #endif
00263 }
00264 
00265 
00266 /* Initialize a uop struct */
00267 void core_t::uop_init(struct uop_t * const uop)
00268 {
00269   int i;
00270   zero_uop(uop);
00271   memset(&uop->alloc,-1,sizeof(uop->alloc));
00272   uop->core = this;
00273   uop->decode.Mop_seq = (seq_t)-1;
00274   uop->decode.uop_seq = (seq_t)-1;
00275   uop->alloc.port_assignment = -1;
00276 
00277   uop->timing.when_decoded = TICK_T_MAX;
00278   uop->timing.when_allocated = TICK_T_MAX;
00279   for(i=0;i<MAX_IDEPS;i++)
00280   {
00281     uop->timing.when_itag_ready[i] = TICK_T_MAX;
00282     uop->timing.when_ival_ready[i] = TICK_T_MAX;
00283   }
00284   uop->timing.when_otag_ready = TICK_T_MAX;
00285   uop->timing.when_ready = TICK_T_MAX;
00286   uop->timing.when_issued = TICK_T_MAX;
00287   uop->timing.when_exec = TICK_T_MAX;
00288   uop->timing.when_completed = TICK_T_MAX;
00289 
00290   uop->exec.action_id = new_action_id();
00291   uop->exec.when_data_loaded = TICK_T_MAX;
00292   uop->exec.when_addr_translated = TICK_T_MAX;
00293 }
